content: caterpillar by sarah quillen www thefidghtyflower com © 2020 sarah quillen caterpillar 1 general information tips and tricks materials this pattern uses bernat blanket yarn bernat baby blanket or bernat blanket brights i have listed in the pattern the largest ball size you should need of each color however it might be hard to find the color wanted in the smaller ball sizes i always buy the large balls 10 5 oz / 300g for this pattern you will need o hook size us k 10 5 / 6 5mm o yarn needle o stitch marker o polyester fiberfill stuffing o 2 safety eyes size indicated in pattern gauge gauge is not important for this pattern if the stitches are sufficiently tight so there is no gaping when stuffed if you have to much gaping or your stitches are too tight and you have difficulty inserting your hook adjust your gauge first then if needed try a different size hook tips this pattern is worked in the round the rounds are worked in continuous spirals without any joins use a stitch marker in the last stitch of each round and move it up as you finish each round i like to use safety pins tricks when you pull your magic_ring closed pull snug but not too tight the blanket yarn does break when the pattern says to stuff firmly you will want to stuff the animal quite full remember as the animal is played with the stuffing will compress www thefidghtyflower com © 2020 sarah quillen caterpillar 2 abbreviations and terms usa chain = chain double_crochet = double_crochet decrease = single_crochet 2 together half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet increase = increase 2 single_crochet in same stitch invdec = invisible decrease insert hook into front loops only of next 2 stitches yarn over pull through 2 loops on hook yarn over pull through final 2 loops on hook counts as 1 single_crochet round s = round s single_crochet = single_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch st s = stitch es repeat the stitches in brackets the indicated number of times # number of stitches in each finished round or row color change magic_ring visit the fidgety flower youtube channel for a demonstration fasten_off pull the yarn through the last loop on the hook and pull tight finish or finish off - use a needle to send yarn tail through your piece to hide it and then cut off what is left of the yarn tail close to close the hole you have left slip_stitch and enlarge loop on hook remove hook and cut yarn leaving a long tail using a needle tread yarn through each stitch in round starting from inside to outside on the next stitch go outside to inside next stitch inside to outside repeating until you have one stitch left skip the last stitch and pull yarn through the loop you left at the start and gently pull to close the hole and tighten up loop www thefidghtyflower com © 2020 sarah
